oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Lieutenant General John Bell Hood
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Carte de visite bust of General John Bell Hood in Confederate uniform.

John Bell Hood took command of the Army of Tennessee in July 1864 succeeding Joseph E. Johnston. At 33 years old, Hood was the youngest of the Confederate generals to command an army. Hood fought at Gettysburg where an exploding shell lost him the use of
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Carte de visite photograph album, Civil War portraits
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Hood, John Bell, 1831-1879; Carte de visite; Busts; Generals--Confederate States of America
